4C4hslVS6XMvKtDj3uqMVQ.text: Very good food. Service was slow. Chili was phenomenal especially if you like spicier chili. I was disappointed how long it took to get a pepperoni pizza, though. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. Very delicious food, just not very speedy service.

aV7O9wX8TJggzvrcKk5fOg.text: The best pizza around!  Great service!  Wings are perfectly cooked!  My only con is parking, but there are public lots across the street and up a block!  Worth the walk!

_smtiZoxNZaitMvzk9TCmg.text: The hubby and I stopped by here last minute for lunch.  The server said that they had a lunch buffet that was getting ready to start.  The buffet included kielbasa and peirogies but you had to ask for them.  You could also get up to 10 wings but you had to ask for those as well.  I went up to the bar and made a salad.  There were lots of choices of items to put on my salad.  As I was doing that the pizzas started coming out.  I took two slices.  The pizza was nice and hot but lacked any flavor.  Bland pizza ruined my appetite.  I ate my salad and left the pizza.  Pizza is one of my favorite foods so it was quite a bummer that I was at a pizza place and left pizza untouched.  Burgh's has been in business many years.  They definitely get a good lunch crowd.  It was almost full when we left.  We had great service, but not great food.  In this case I am going to say that it was just me and I was having an off day.  I will go back another time and try the buffet again.  Next time I will sample the wings as well.  I'll post an update when I go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgh's Pizza & Wing Pub - Bridgeville, PA, United States

NmQKPc32Sd7sKBQZwO4Fyg.text: Our party of 6 (4 adults and 2 children) arrived at 5PM last Saturday night to celebrate a birthday and were told there would be a wait for the table - no problem. Once we were seated, our waitress came around and took our drink orders and we decided to place our food orders at that time as well. One adult wing order and a child's pasta came out after a reasonable time. And then the wait began...15 minutes.....30 minutes.....and all the while our waitress was taking food orders to other tables. During this time she asked one adult at our table if they wanted another drink forgetting the other 5 people at the table! After about 40 minutes, we asked her where were the 2 chicken salads, the burger and the small pizza? By the time the other 4 meals arrived, the first 2 people had finished eating. We have been at Burgh's before and have never had a bad experience. However, after last weekend's decidedly horrible dinner out, we won't be going back.

mlXiWOBgReARvV4_zY6kHQ.text: I have always enjoyed the food here, which is why I'm giving them one star. Unfortunately, everything else about this place is consistently unimpressive. Like another reviewer on here stated, I keep giving them chances thinking that things will improve, but they never do. It took over a half an hour to get a basket of garlic fries and it took 20 minutes on top of that to get our actual food, which was lukewarm. I was informed that "pretty much everything" that was on draft was out after waiting 10 minutes for a beer that I ordered. Shouldn't the server already know what's been kicked if it's "pretty much everything?" And before you start thinking they were swamped, the restaurant was basically empty. There was no reason for any kind of delay, even if they were short-staffed. Since this is a consistent, systemic problem, I won't be returning until I hear the place is under new management. Current management either doesn't know or doesn't care how to adequately train serving staff. I can pay $70 for three people to have dinner at a much better restaurant and I'll be out of there in less than two hours.

LPZ4iSKQDy2-ySHoiME4qw.text: Was excited to dine at Burgh's yesterday and made the trip from Washington in the mood for the white pizza that I love. As soon as we walked through the lounge side it was a complete disaster. Every booth/table had every courses plate and drink glass on the table. Between patiently waiting fifteen minutes for some kind of acknowledgement from staff, I noticed the half inch of thick dust all over the fans that hung over the bar and caked on the vents. If the restaurant doesn't care about the cleanliness of the restaurant that guests see I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like! Lost appetite and we left.

5ZauKmnz9pMGzuz_Y_QznQ.text: First, I only downloaded this app to write this review, the service was absolutely terrible, when speaking to the managers they did not even bother talking to the waiter they simply had someone else do their work for them so they can continue having fun and not care about the customer. The order was wrong, the waitress would disappear for very long periods of time. Food is good but simply not worth the crap service that we received. Managers should fix the attitudes. Didn't even give us the respect to return our checks to us, had the bus boy do it for her. Waitress was a short hair blonde. Won't be coming back.

JaTjJG-t9u5bBV2NSsaGYQ.text: Wrote them an email last week about the worst dining experience of my life but they didn't have the decency to reply. It was the worst experience for many reasons ranging from: hostess not seating people when tables were open for over ten minutes, incorrect orders, inedible food because it was so overcooked, terrible service, no beverages during the meal, Waiting one hour for an appetizer and even longer for pizza, and the waitress keeping my change when I paid cash and did not tell her to keep the change.

cIx2NIEMl8LZUkPIT3zhSQ.text: Stopped in yesterday for lunch as we're looking for houses in the area and a few friends recommended it.  The atmosphere was nice had a sports bar feel without being a sportsbar. Service seemed good, but they were moderately busy.  My wife & I each ordered the buffet. Priced at 10.99 you get salad, pizza, soup, 5 wings, and a sample of the daily special. That was a great opportunity for us to try some different items.  For the wings we got garlic parmesan & honey bbq. The garlic parmesan was a buttery gsrlic sauce with fresh parmesan, which was what we expected & didn't disappoint. The honey bbq was sweet with an almost vinegar flavor and a nice kick. I'd definitely get those again.  The pizzas on the buffet were good and about what you'd expect (crunchy crust, sauce that seemed chunky with a bit of sweetness).

We30Xw_m2Mtmh5vgZZdmDQ.text: I've been to Burgh's multiple times and this is the time I am reviewing it.  My latest visit I had wings and fries.  Wings were slightly over cooked but tasty.  Many sauce variations are present.  They have 25 ounce domestic draft beer options too.  I had an order of fries with my wings.  Previous visits had me order wings or hoagies.  All were very good and the service has been consistent.  My friend ordered a pizza to go as well.  I am dumbfounded that I don't visit Burghs more often.  It isn't far from my house, with good food, and attentive service.   I need to stop more often.

dXxLhOj3w8FirJ4qp2EXYg.text: Best pizza and wings around.. pizza crust is always crispy and delicious, just how I like it. Service is kinda slow but the food makes up for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgh's Pizza & Wing Pub - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Cobb salad

JleOeZQZG2Va4ZBp90kstg.text: I have been here many times in the past and will day they have some good food.  But like many of the other reviews say the service is what keeps this place from being great.    It's not for a lack of effort on the staff's part.  My last time there our server Stephanie was running around doing everything she could.  However, they seemed to be pretty understaffed, as both the restaurant and bar were full, as is to be expected on a weekend night.  Because of this things did not go very smoothly.  My wife and I both ordered a couple of beers during our meals which took very long to get to us. Our appetizer order of pierogies came out still frozen in the middle.  Also, we ended up being there for about an hour and a half, and all we ordered was pizza.  I will say the food is very good.  We had some buffalo wings which were cooked and sauces perfectly.  It went perfectly with their delicious house made ranch.  The pizza was one of the better ones I've had in awhile.  The crust was crispy and flavorful and the sauce had a great flavor.  I also like how they put some of the sauce above the cheese.  I will definitely be back at some point because of the good food, I just wish they would fix some of the service issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Burgh's Pizza & Wing Pub - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Cheese pizza

rEbEWXnGoyLiiHb8pr2-1w.text: I would have to say best Pizza and Wings in the Burgh. Depending on the style of pizza you like of course !!!! Always top notch service no matter how busy it is. Have been coming here for years.  They have a HUGE beer selection on tap and bottles . Anyways I would recommend this place for lunch or dinner just make sure you come hungry and or thirsty !

5UaLobTj1tMxHll7maG9kA.text: Pierogies- 1 star Pizza- 4 stars Wings- 5 stars  Service- 3 stars  We came here on a Friday night and it was decently busy. Our server came over and we ordered beers and Waters. I had to explain to her the difference in Southern Tier beers and we never received our waters, but hey that's alright.   Next we ordered pierogies, wings and pizza. She told us the pizza would be 45 mins which is a little crazy, but I'm happy she gave us a heads up! The pierogies came out after a half hour FROZEN INSIDE. Legit frozen. She took them back and brought the same ones back out now just dry and burnt. She did take them off the bill though so we appreciated that. The wings came next. We had the flavor that was both a dry rub and a mild buffalo. They were some of the best wings I've ever had. Very crunchy with an amazing flavor. The ranch was homemade and delicious too! The pizza was last and was actually worth the wait. It was a fresh, thick dough, but not too thick. It was cooked well so it was crunchy and not soggy. They also put sauce both under and on top of the cheese which was very good.  The prices are very fair as well. Overall it was a good experience. They just really need to work on their staffing on a Friday night. Our server was working so hard trying to keep up! I can't wait to go back for those wings!

UmguxbtidvAZDXm7FAdx7g.text: Looooooove this place!! In my top 5 fave list in the Pittsburgh area. Always great, I'm a burger connosuer, the Cheesy, Bacon burger is awesome! Half pound burger cooked to order, topped with LOTS of crispy, delicious bacon, cheddar and smoked gouda cheese, hence the name!!! I always order grilled onions on mine, then covered with a southwest spicy sauce, this burger is a winner!! Side of crunchy, yummy onion rings, Burghs is always great!!!

KoHYsdtzzwuGMlGMTku9Wg.text: Super wings and pizza as well as calzones and  one of the best Rubens ever but you have to try the large antipasto, it can feed a family of four. Great beer selection and yes it gets busy. Enjoy a beverage, it is worth the wait. Terrific lunch buffet also

a0PjmKcEzZKCAFiPH5ISyA.text: Just delicious.  I try to order 1 time per week.  Service is good food is great.  Worth the trip

oaRb751VyliaNtI046lRzA.text: This place is subpar. Nice if you're trying to catch a game but the service isn't all that great. Yeah, our waiter was nice but I think we literally had 3 interactions with him the whole night. Once when he took our order, once when he brought us food, and once for the check.  The food is also not that spectacular. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and it was just lettuce and dry chicken and Caesar dressing. My friend ordered the Super chicken pizza and that was actually really great. My other friend ordered the pierogie appetizer and they were so hard.  Since it's conveniently located close to work, I'll probably be returning. Hopefully the service is a lot better next time!

ZaGVMlaou9fHu6lbVCri_A.text: We went here tonight to celebrate National Pizza Day. We couldn't have made a better choice!   We started with wings. They were excellent. Crispy & juice & flavorful. Great!  Then we moved on to the main attraction. The cheese pizza was delicious & the meat pizza (pepperoni & sausage & bacon) was even better!

9nmtOZSDKdUTHohRend3Jg.text: The Food was good. The server was very friendly. Bit it took over 45 mins from when we ordered to get our food..I have eaten here many other times and have had the same problems I stayed away for a while thinking that this may be resolved but it didn't that's why I am not leaving a good review

wvXQoJI47h6-LK3RszJ57w.text: Such a shame... decent food, but consistently awful service. Like, for YEARS. Every so often I give them another try, and each time I'm more disappointed than the last time. Slow to seat, exorbitantly long wait times for your food, and if you're lucky it's all brought out at the same time. On one occasion, three of us got our food but the fourth in our group had to wait an extra 20 minutes for his.   Most recently it took 45 minutes for our food to arrive (not on a busy night), then when we finally were done with our meal it was another 15-20 minutes before our server made an appearance with our check. We could have easily walked out without paying an no one would have noticed.  The worst part is that there are never any excuses offered or apologies given. I'm a pretty understanding person - I know there are situations that can affect service like someone calling in sick, which is why I've returned. But EVERY time the service is lousy and the staff is unapologetic. I have to place the blame on the owners and/or managers who are hiring and training incorrectly.  Maybe, just maybe... if some day I hear that things have improved I will return. But for now I'll stick with Bubba's.

or2_qN6dqNEWsK_5FSXDWQ.text: Very good food. Great prices friendly service. Wings are good and great variety.  So worth the trio6

9qVwKL3vK6c6n-0hb2c20w.text: At least they are consistent. We have been there three times in three years and have never had good (or even average) service even when there were very few customers. I want to like this place which is why we tried it a few times.  The slow, I mean sloooow, service and inattentive staff don't give us any reason to go back. I would give it two stars but the white pizza was delicious so I added a star.

bjYl_RK17Rw1fmGuD-A7cA.text: The food is good her but nothing extraordinary. I recommend their pizza over their wings. It's small with not a lot of seating. Extensive beer menu but may not have everything listed. Not a bad choice for dinner but not my favorite.

yFRwg5x-2xU_fAFaqinCuA.text: Ordered for the super bowl, an understandably busy day- Was told my order would take an hour but would ultimately end up taking twice that, really setting me back for a party I was hosting myself. I thought this was really inconsiderate as I would have made other arrangements with a better expectation. The wings were prepared in a very rushed manner as they weren't even fully covered with sauce. Upon getting home I noticed my bag was full of sauce as one of the containers was not fully closed. Will head back to dine in but will never use their takeout again.  On a positive note, the garlic parm wings I ordered were awesome. I can't say the same for the buffalo. These were the ones where the sauce was everywhere except on the wings.

6ZoV8cWJao0DCI69QbUcpw.text: I love love love Burgh's! I have been many times, and have never been disappointed! In my opinion, they have the best pizza in Pittsburgh. SO many options, literally something for everyone! I love the white pizza, but I like to switch it up to the buffalo chicken salad every now and then. The salads are jammed packed with vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, roasted red peppers, and even chick peas! Their sauces and dressings are all home made and phenomenal. My husband, on the other hand, refuses to get any thing other than the deep dish pizza and buffalo wings. He loves them that much. I wish we lived closer, because we would probably get take out weekly! Definitely a great sports bar to cheer on your favorite Pittsburgh team!  It's always packed on the weekends, so be prepared to wait a little. Trust me, Burgh's is worth the wait!

33gQkOecQFom1rlt9NP5fA.text: Love this place! Just a short drive from West Virginia it's worth the 35 min drive. Amazing food!!! Wings, pizza and the most amazing anti pasta salad in the world!!

lt_cZRSAG1Ldwi6uKUrFHA.text: Wings are awesome!  The lunch buffet is usually really good, with a good selection.  Not the healthiest food in town, but when you want fried chicken... this is a good place to go.  Pizza is kinda mehhh, but not bad.

SNBgoZ6VBvj--8eE5YvfYg.text: Great experience today.  Good food, great service!  Great place to take friends from out of town to show off a real Pittsburgh eatery.  Thank you , we enjoyed it.

PQsUbMZVT2bQXt-txzmMzg.text: Burgh's is one of my absolute favorite "go to" places! We love trying new places to eat and we really have to like a place to keep going back.  Burgh's is definitely one of those places!!!  The menu has something for everyone and I've never been disappointed with anything that I've ordered. The pizza is some of the best around and the wings win hands down as my all time favorite!!  They're always cooked perfectly crispy and the sauces are phenonmenal!!!  The beer selection is outstanding.  Service can be slow at times - Fridays and Saturdays are always packed, so yes, expect a wait.  But overall, Burgh's is hard to beat!!

OUrtdl-y19GL5FJIVtF7bA.text: Probably the best sports bar in western PA! It is always a crowed place with the locals watching a game and visiting with friends. The food is tremendous and they will always accommodate in how you want the food prepared. Wings are cooked to perfection and the pepperoni dream is truly amazing. You may have to wait for a table, but they provides an opportunity to grab a drink, visit with the locals, and play a game of pool. If you need a place to watch a game or relax after a busy week--then this is your place!

HL23HTsKo12EaqIBX7vcOQ.text: It gets 2 stars because my deep fried soft pretzel was yummy.  Being the first customers in the restaurant (opened at 11, and we were on our lunch hour), we were seated right away - staff was very nice.  And then we waited nearly 20 minutes before anyone came to take our order - in an empty restaurant.  Fried pretzel, tuna melt...that's it.  20 minutes after ordering, we finally got our food.  I've had good food and bad food here - but the service is always consistently horrible.  Boo hiss.

7xMIcv-cRFNr1zWXdONRWw.text: Food is excellent  One of the best Pizzas in the area.  Service can be a little slow.  If you are not a regular or townie you can be ignored when it is busy.  If employees were more friendly this would be 5 stars

vwBipU1muj5VorDaXAnp7A.text: This place is awful! I have been here twice and both times were terrible. The cooks are straight up on meth and the waitresses are so nasty! We had guacamole that was $8 and it came with stale chips and giant tomatoes! It wasn't even mixed together. I ordered 4 separate beers on tap- they were out of all of them! Won't ever ever go back!

WB1a2qk9rCB0tjVBDmM9Tg.text: User J.K. stated my previous review was too vague...so here is a more specific review: I've gone to Burgh's several times in the past. All of the negative reviews, I can attest to. I've never received good service while dining at Burgh's. the last visit in particular, I ordered the guacamole appetizer to start. I was told they had no avocados...then, for some strange reason, I was told by my server that the manager had a few in his office?!  Out comes mashed avocados with tortilla chips...not guacamole! It is more than just mashed avocados. The server never refilled our beverages...not once. Our pizza was kind of mushy in the middle, as if the middle wasn't cooked all the way. I didn't finish my first slice. Just sat and waited for our server to check on us. When she returned, she didn't ask how everything was. She just offered us a box to take our leftovers home. Now, for me to recall that very last dining experience, which I believe was this past summer, it was pretty bad. Even with take out...we have ordered by phone to pick up in, what you are told "20-25 minutes". We go in about that time and still wait another 15 minutes. It's frustrating to have such a good location and not give a rats "you know what" about your business or the locals who support it. So...just giving a one time example takes up this much space...I have to be vague. These reviews, I believe, are very True to their nature, because going there on my own free will on several occasions, receiving the same bad service with occasionally good pizza, isn't worth my hard earned money. I'll spend it at Cucina Bella, where the food AND service is always great! I hope that was more detailed for you :-)

SQLVrqxSOk5QnyWi5adYSw.text: Good size portion, fast friendly staff. Food up quickly. Nice variety of beers. I would go back!

N1cOoZQvaWxsl6AaII270w.text: Their meat trio deep dish pizza was simply awesome. In fact, it was one of the best deep dish pizzas that I have outside Chicago and it reminded me alot of Chicago's Ginos East.  It was also turned out to be one of the best cold pizzas I have had as well and usually deep dish pizzas don't taste well after they cooled, but the Burgh's pizza was great.  We had our pizza picked up from a friend, so I cannot speak to the establishment or it's staff, but next time I am in town I will certainly go and try some pizza fresh from the oven.

TJ1-IrbUD358DQWDN57T1A.text: Sometimes I have a great time at burghs while others it's like why did I even bother.   They have a fantastic selection of beer and the bartenders are usually very nice  My biggest problem is how long the food takes. It seems to be either 5 minutes or 55 minutes and I can't figure it.   But if you have time to kill and want to enjoy a beer and watch a game. Burgh's is a great sopt

IpwirA5wzAqEm5LNjZxk_Q.text: First time here. Will be back! Glad we didn't read the reviews until we were already seated. They DO need a sign that says to see the host,etc because we had to ask the guys standing in front of us if it was a "seat yourself". The "host" was certainly not paying any attention to guest walking in the door. We had to put our name on the list and were not told how long the wait was (maybe a more attentive host would help give a better rating). We only waited 5 min to be seated; in the bar area. Our server Shannon was very friendly and when we told her this was our first visit, she told us what they r known for (pizza and wings). We decided to try the (5) wings as an app and a toss salad to start. The wings had great flavor and meaty. We wanted to steer away from the usual pepperoni pizza so we ordered the "super chicken white pizza" and added bacon! It was very tasty! We loved the crust! It was a little dry...not much sauce, but the chicken was tender and plenty of broccoli. A small was more than enough for the two of us considering we had the wings and salad. She told us the burgers r huge and very good so we plan to come back to try one. Atmosphere is typical friendly local bar. Looking forward to returning for a burger.    Try it...you'll like it!!

JsFrh2vgffzPqbVsICzQHQ.text: We were looking for a laid back venue to host our rehearsal dinner, and came across Burgh's Pizza & Wing Pub. The prices were affordable, and they provided PLENTY of food for our party- we had a lot of leftovers at the end of the night. We really appreciated that they never skimped on food towards the end of the evening. For our group of ~30, we had one dedicated staff member who worked hard to keep the food and drinks stocked (we were doing a buffet style dinner, so one person was more than enough). The booking process was also very easy- Dan was easily accessible and happy to take my calls on his cell phone when he wasn't working. If we ever had the need for another private party in the area, I would certainly consider booking with them again.

rMcAun2S5PcmV2X7LTS7EQ.text: Rude, slow, and expensive. Also, if you dare use the jukebox an employee will critique your choices of music. They have a good bottle selection but they don't treat customers well so weigh that. If you want to spend money there are better choices on the same street.

zeyjW-wVNsBJFoTlw-QNzg.text: Where can you wait an hour for bad over-priced food while watching a pregnant woman chain smoke and drink 2-3 beers?  Welcome to Burgh's.  There has always been something magical about this specific location.  I remember back in the days when this was the site of the Galaxy theater, where I got to watch ET and First Blood Part 2 in a double feature (back in the 80s).  Burgh's somehow lacks the class of the Galaxy theater.  But you can expect a bad pizza bar for lunch, fantastic deep fried pretzels with the world's best honey-mustard, a nice selection of beers (hurray for the Belgian revolution), and some townie sight-seeing.  I feel at home already.

TnxiUEvBY3b0zNI_3j_a1A.text: This is too funny , my whole family went to Burgs last nite . They tell us a short wait so we go to the bar waiting and waiting so we ask the bartender if we can order wings now as its 30-35 minutes to cook . She says sure . So we order assuming will sit soon only to find our table was giving away !! My wife and daughters find the manager Tom as he seemed bothered and unwilling to help so we decide to leave . He says you have an order in for about 70 dollars we said yes we do but if you can't seat us we're leaving and he says I'll call the police at that comment I stand up and let him know , look dude you've given the girls a hard time with seating and now your calling the police lol , to funny so I said you do that , please call them . I'll wait for this just to make a complete fool out of you . He got snippy with me saying I don't appreciated that and we left .    Not sure who Tom is but he's sure a fine representative of Burgs , we won't return that's certain !!  I had to place 1 star above just to enter a review . Classy operation !!!!

mi9w3omKw9dLN2tsrckKpA.text: Burgh's is about a 4 star restaurants with a less than 1 star staff.  The service could not be any worse than it is.  You will always be waiting on an un-informed and un-trained wait staff for everything you have to do here from drink orders to food orders to getting food to getting the check.  The food is very good I have never had bad food here and the beer selection is not bad my wife and I attemp burgh's about once a year each time hoping they fixed there service issuse always to be disappointed.

nu-P20cZ5TUsHd0BSbUv0w.text: Wings, pizza, and a monstrous selection of great beers... ah, yes please.  Burgh's has become a staple of mine on each trip to the Burgh to visit my family.  For those of you in, or around, the South Hills, you must stop here.  It's very similar to Fat Heads in Southside.  I'm a big fan of the hot, garlic, and cajun-hot wings.  For the unfamiliar, the cajun-hot come with a blackened, somewhat ashy crust.  The texture can be outputting for some, but the flavor is awesome (fyi - it takes a little extra time for the cajun-hots, so be aware).  My other favorite is the garlic-hot, but it's a mandatory rule that if one person eats them, everyone at the table must eat them (i.e., not recommended for dates).  The True reason to go here is for the beer.  They have over 20 beers on tap (I can't remember the exact number, but I always seem to find something that I haven't tried before), and their bottled beer selection is equally extensive.

VYwvHt2TQdaP-oUtSSKA7A.text: We were anticipating great things due to word of mouth and were extremely disappointed. After spending over $50.00 for pizza and wings, they were not even cooked fully.  The wing sauce was awful.

8zL_5aABqPap-t7PxUnAtA.text: The service at Burgh's is consistently horrible, with a 45 minute wait just for drinks being a common issue. However, the food is pretty good. The pizza especially is above average, but the service and slow pace of every employee there detracts from just how good the pizza is.

RCWapCA-fOz41j72Em88gw.text: The Good: * Pizza & Wings are usually very good.  And everything else on the menu is decent * Excellent beer menu - lots on tap, 100+ bottles * Family friendly  * Very cool bar area that's usually pretty busy  The Bad: * The service is very slow.  I've been there 30+ times and you will NEVER get food under 30 min from when you ordered.  They are either understaffed, poorly managed, or both. * Dirty - The carpet in the dinning room is nasty and every plate is stained. I frequently have had to ask for a new plate either b/c it was dirty or wet * Sports Bar? - There are TV's everywhere, but they don't have the sports packages to be able to show any game.  Everyone is stuck w/ whatever is on the network channel.   * Parking - Good luck.  On a weekend night, you will not be able to find parking.   Overall: Good food and decent atmosphere...But, if there were more places in Bridgeville/South Fayette Burghs would lose a lot of business.

3s8L2l0ZOw9FmPeC16_pXg.text: This place is great for pizza. It's a local spot, a bit pricey however it is well worth it. Their wings are great, we have the spivey garlic. And for pizza. Try their Zesty Italian. I hope this helps, enjoy.

XyhMAobmjZD8MSWM9MGHEw.text: Just tried Burgh's Wings & Pizza last night. Although the croud was wayyy to much for the building , the wings were really good. I would recommend the Golden Tangy . Those were my favorite.  Kinda pricey , but might be worth it. I Agree with Matt K, I don't think they deserve such a low score here. buncha foodie snobs i guess ?

Yd5gV8cW6lMY_iashctxQw.text: Best buffet brunch around especially if you love soups, salads, pizza & wings, dessert & a beverage all included for a very reasonable price! But you just may need a nap from all that food ;-) Great for the whole family with games & sports tv everywhere.

_VuV0dTK2UrtYt2Y1C88Aw.text: Horrible service. The server was nice but we waited well over an hour for food. 2 burgers came out and we still had none of the 2 pizzas we ordered. I will not be back. Ever!

EJXTwAxvT4udeQmksvzMWQ.text: Their menu says they only serve the fish sandwich on Friday, thank god.  Ordered mine with the onion rings (posted a picture), waited 45 minutes, came out way over cooked and uneatable. Probably more of a pizza and beer place. Not for me.

6FnCmstqAOeOp1-ctyAn_Q.text: I come from Michigan and I have to stop in everytime I am in Pittsburgh.  Best deep dish I have had amd the beer selection is outstanding.

-yL_4tHajJDI8x7i1CxHQw.text: Disregard my previous post as I thought someone had stole my information from this place.  It turns out that it was a misunderstanding by the police in that area.  So in regards to that I'm going to give my original review of this place.  The food was very good.  I had the Curtiss sandwich because, well... isn't it obvious?  Anything that has pastrami, egg, and bacon, all on the same thing is totally me(Its practically what I order as Primanti Brothers everytime)  As far as the customer service, I had no complaints, but I will say that we were a party of two.  Probably is pretty crappy for parties of 4 as we noticed people waiting around for awhile after we were seated.  The prices were reasonable and they had a huge selection of good beers to choose from.

iax7aLVfu_2r_6ES7CQGhw.text: Been there 4 times and have no idea why.  It's sad bc their food is pretty good but service is not so good.  When asked about the beer specials I was told there weren't any. I then asked the server ok well why does the sign say there is? She then started to retract her statement and tell us there indeed is. This is only one example. Every time we have been it seems as though no server wants to be there and are unable to answer any questions.  Like I said food is good, so if we ever go back it will be for take out!

lXvq1vSRG59NfremHoZFeg.text: I love everything that I have ever eaten at Burghs. Everything is delicious. My personal favorite is the pizza, it really is great. My recommendation? The 5 cheese pizza with sausage added to it is top notch. Yum!

dsBMjWnr3im8LDABxZO-xg.text: Food is great if you can get it in under two hours. Staff is clueless and doesn't care, manager/owner has told many people " leave if you  aren't happy" Great beer, great food if you have 3 hours to wait, horrible wrong-side-of-the tracks GED- aspirant employees who are fully supported by the lowbrow managers/owners who of course only see money. So why do people still  patronize this place? I don't know ! It defies logic. The best thing here is that the management and employees know this and won't post here.

_wNulucY6BPAjwa31pZ2xQ.text: HORRIBLE service..ended up seating myself because no one was around after a good 5 min to seat us, then the waitress took FOREVER to both notice us and get simple drinks.    Eventually, once the waitress realized we were a paying customer, we were able to order wings and pizza.  After an enormous amount of time without offers of alcohol refills, we were served greasy wings with common obviously warehouse sauces. Again, no drink refills.    The pizza came a good 30 minutes later so half our group got to watch each other eat.  The pizza was odd tasting.  Service:  Abysmal,  Food:  Not matching the hype.

OdJTOOjK_xDw_wKID1zUmQ.text: Food quality has gone way down.  I know it is a pub, but even a pub needs some minimal standards for food quality. Hope it changes some day.

T-vb82k1aLO03YXQMvbavA.text: I've been a regular customer for years. The food is generally good, but the service can be spotty. However, of the last five pizzas I've ordered, three were burnt. Two I sent back, and one I ate because it was less burnt than the one I sent back. Also, I recently went there on a Saturday afternoon to have a couple of beers and some wings and watch some college football. But, someone was playing the juke box, which cuts out the sound from ll twelve TV's in the bar. Basically, one person had hijacked the entire bar from the sports fans who were there. The juke box should be turned off on heavy game days. I'll go back but not as often.

pz40DVkjdAjZ_F1-cMP6eQ.text: TERRIBLE !! Got here for lunch buffet suppose to be ready by 11:30 it's 11:50 still not out. Wasted half of my lunch hour waiting. I will never be back. Wings badly over cooked.

YOnvJMfG78znKJCN7lAg6Q.text: Their wings and pizza are both amazing and their beer selection is really good too. I noticed a lot of negative reviews based on poor service, but luckily, that has not been my experience.

_lFDKw_Jr94eM2KDy0QHyA.text: Good thing the food is good because the service, cleanliness, and general environment are sub par. Ordered side salads and they came two minutes before our pizza, after waiting nearly 30 minutes!  Our drinks sat empty and trying to get your servers attention is near impossible because she's fraternizing with the other wait staff and floor manager behind the bar. Let's not even mention the welcome when you try to put your name on the list. Unless you're a regular here I wouldn't bother because the service is most unpleasant. My suggestion is take out. This place needs a heaping helping of Robert Irvine and Restaurant Impossible!

SBNS9rsBhsa-hLtMllrVmg.text: Here's the deal: I like beer. And the beer selection at Burgh's is spot on. 21st Amendment on tap is fantastic, so I thought this would be a go-to pub for future impromptu dinners.  With a name like "Pizza and Wing Pub", I would have assumed that those two menu items would be top notch. I decided to give the poultry a try and was completely disappointed. The order of 10 garlic parmesan wings resulted in 2 flats and 8 drums (inexcusable) and they were fried to a crisp, leaving a chewy leathery remnant of fowl. I was charged $0.70 for a half-full mini-cup of "blue cheese" which was a rather cheap dressing with no actual chunks of blue cheese present.  The waitress didn't take notice that the grown man consumed only 6 of the 10 chew toys, and was rather surprised when I asked for more blue cheese after the first two flats were consumed.  My wife accompanied me on this venture, and received the wrong brew (which they quickly replaced with the correct one). A completely excusable mistake had the other issues not followed. My wife ordered a cheddar cheeseburger which tasted rather like a steamed clump of ground beef (I was rather famished after giving up on my wings and didn't believe her that the burger wasn't tasty; I apologized later for doubting her).  I do not plan to return. 'Hope this was helpful.

hjoWDuYbhpBIrOtBnwfr9A.text: Great food & awesome Pizza. Lots of Yinzers. Good beer selection. Service is below ave, gossipy, & not the nicest. They are busy so give them a break I suppose.

BRdoKYASPZww4EZXRqfPMg.text: It was a bit crowded, but we went at dinner time just before a Pens game so that gets a pass. We only got their thin crust pizza with extra cheese, but it was one of the better ones I've had. There was actually plenty of cheese (unlike the big pizza chains) and there was a perfect amount of sauce. The crust was nice and crispy, too, which is what I want out of a thin crust pizza. Service was quick and friendly, and most importantly, the beer selection was impressive.
